account.note: I’m a computer programmer, Linux admin, and a Japanese music fan? I contribute to MusicBrainz and BigBlueButton (while working for Blindside Networks) // he/him

content:
Great, new BIOS update and it reset everything so now I have to set up the ram all over again.
And now the "A-XMP" auto memory setting doesn't work for 2666MHz at all.
Worked fine if I manually entered the settings tho, at least once I remembered that the ram I have is CL16, not 15. (Although 15 did boot when I overvolted it a little, huh.)

Hmm. It looks like the A-XMP setting wasn't working in the previous BIOS either, it was probably in a fallback 2133MHz mode.
